message: The #hikewithMike challenge is more than half-way to completion! This week we’re marching through South Dakota’s Badlands National Park. At 242,000 acres, this expansive collection of canyons, gullies, ridges, and mesas is sometimes referred to as a strange and distant planet. The soft sedimentary rocks and grassy plains hold millions of fossils of extinct animals that roamed America more than 40 million years ago.    Additional reminder – the mile tracker board will be updated next Thursday so please have your mile total submitted by Wednesday.

"For the last eight years, businesses and families have been over burdened by government rules and regulations that stymied our economy from achieving its true potential. I was pleased when President Trump talked about the forgotten Americans that have been left behind over the past two decades.  I'm looking forward to working with the President and his Administration to implement policies that create jobs and fuel economic growth. When we all work together, Americans benefit and I am encouraged the President touched on this important concept as part of his vision."

Tomorrow is the national kickoff for the American Dental Association’s 2017 Give Kids a Smile event. As a former dentist, I’m a strong supporter of this annual program which provides millions of kids in need with free oral health services.   For events and clinics in Idaho, contact the Idaho State Dental Association. #GKAS

Enjoyed touring U.S. Department of Energy sites last week, including the Salt Waste Processing Facility in Aiken, South Carolina as part of my work as Chairman of the Energy and Water Appropriations Subcommittee under the House Committee on Appropriations - Republicans.

Excited to learn that Idaho-based Chobani, LLC earned a spot on Fast Company magazine’s annual ranking of the world’s 50 Most Innovative Companies for 2017.   This announcement comes on the heels of a $100 million investment into their Twin Falls yogurt plant last year. This underscores what many Idahoans already know, our state is a great place to invest and create jobs. #economicdevelopment #idaho  https://www.fastcompany.com/3067464/most-innovative-companies/why-chobani-is-one-of-the-most-innovative-companies-of-2017
ICYMI: ICYMI: Congressman Simpson cosponsors legislation that protects patients with pre-existing conditions.   http://www.localnews8.com/news/simpson-co-sponsors-health-care-reform-bill/339987340

I had a great time participating in the Blue Cross of Idaho Steps for Schools Walking Challenge. Since 2014, this innovative program has encouraged students and legislators to lead healthy, active lifestyles by tracking their steps at work and school.   Today, I was joined by members of the Idaho Legislature and students from several Boise schools. #hikewithMike.

Idaho students interested in applying for acceptance into one of the nation’s premier military academies will have four opportunities to learn about the process in March.   This year, the United States Military Academy at West Point; the U.S. Naval Academy; the U.S. Air Force Academy, the U.S. Merchant Marine Academy and the U.S. Coast Guard Academy along with staff from Idaho’s Congressional Delegation will all be represented at each event.

Congratulations to Secretary of Energy, Rick Perry on his confirmation. Secretary Perry will face a number of critical issues including maintaining our nuclear deterrent, overseeing the national lab system as they push the bounds of scientific research and development, and meeting our commitments to states on nuclear cleanup. As Chairman of the Energy and Water Appropriations Subcommittee, I look forward to working with Secretary Perry to promote national security, pursue a truly all-of-the-above energy policy, and enhance American competitiveness.
Thanks to @SecretaryZinke and @Interior for highlighting Idaho’s Jim McClure-Jerry Peak Wilderness as one of the nation’s public lands hidden gems! Photo 16. http://usat.ly/2momY30

ICYMI: Simpson, Labrador Introduce Agreement on Gateway West Transmission Line   “The Gateway West Transmission Line through the Morley Nelson-Snake River Birds of Prey National Conservation Area, long supported by most of the parties, finally has a path to approval. Idaho Republican Rep. Mike Simpson brokered the deal that will come in the form of legislation supported by the entire Idaho congressional delegation…”   http://www.idahostatesman.com/news/local/news-columns-blogs/letters-from-the-west/article141023738.html#storylink=cpy

Proud to see a business with strong Idaho ties getting the national attention it deserves. Their investment in Twin Falls has benefited the local economy and created jobs throughout the Magic Valley. See Chobani’s story tonight on CBS 60 Minutes.  “The name Chobani means shepherd. It’s a very beautiful word because it represents peace, giving, and kindness. It meant a lot to me.”  – Hamdi Ulukaya, Chobani, founder and CEO.  http://www.cbsnews.com/news/chobani-founder-stands-by-hiring-refugees/

Many Idahoans were impacted by the wet winter weather that damaged infrastructure and other important parts of our state. I am pleased President Trump is acting decisively to help Idahoans recover from the harsh winter.   http://www.kmvt.com/content/news/11-southern-Idaho-counties-to-receive-federal-disaster-aid--420114294.html
ICYMI: Idaho Veterans can now schedule appointments at the Boise VAMC from their smart phone, tablet or computer.  More information in the attached flyer.

I'd like to thank Energy Secretary Rick Perry and Navy Admiral James Caldwell for touring the Idaho National Laboratory and meeting with the lab's dedicated employees to discuss our nation's energy future.

Thank you to the YouthBuild staff and participants in Twin Falls for sharing your stories and successes with me. I enjoyed learning more about YouthBuild USA and I look forward to following your progress!

“Not surprised that United Vision for Idaho is misleading the public about Congressman Simpson’s travel plans – he never had a flight to Washington, D.C. flying out of Boise today.”   Nikki Wallace - District and Communications Director for Rep. Mike Simpson

Congratulations to Boise resident and World War II veteran Lawrence Ridenour for receiving an honorary diploma from Boise High School 72 years after leaving school to join the war effort. Idaho thanks you for your service!

“Today, Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson and Oregon Congressman Kurt Schrader reintroduced the Wildfire Disaster Funding Act to fix the broken budgeting system currently used to fight wildfires, freeing up needed resources for forest health and maintenance projects. #WDFA #FireFix.
Kathy and I are praying for Rep. Scalise, staff, and the Capitol Police officers. We are grateful and humbled by the amazing law enforcement who put their lives in harm’s way to protect our citizens.

Congratulations to Bonneville High School student Reilly Hendrix, the grand prize winner of the 2017 High School Congressional Art Contest for Idaho's Second Congressional District.   Reilly's painting entitled "Generations" will hang in the U.S. Capitol Building for the next year.

Happy Birthday, Idaho! On July 3, 1890, Idaho moved from territory to statehood. Check out the Idaho resources page on the #LibraryofCongress website for historical photos, maps, news articles, and other archived materials.

"This is the kind of behind-the-scenes work that sometimes goes unnoticed back home, but take note: Simpson just performed the equivalent of a Houdini-style escape from certain death and eastern Idaho should be cheering."   - Katie Stokes - Idaho Falls Post Register

Kathy and I were saddened to hear of the passing of Lyle Smith, Boise State University’s legendary football coach and former athletic director. As a World War II veteran, Lyle’s tenacity and vision for #BSU athletics inspired a culture of pride, professionalism, dedication, and loyalty that remains woven throughout the blue turf today. Lyle was well-known across the state of Idaho, and he will surely be missed.

Nobody wants dirty water, but the states were doing a good job managing certain waterways prior to the EPA’s Waters of the United States (WOTUS) rule.   Today, Congress passed my Energy and Water appropriations bill containing a provision to return state control to waters vital to the agricultural heritage in Idaho and other western states.  Learn more about the WOTUS debate in this 2015 Idaho Reports segment.
Great speaking to the Idaho Dairymen yesterday in Twin Falls about the important issues facing their industry.

Spent the day in eastern Idaho meeting with my constituents and speaking to several organizations.   Thank you to the Idaho Falls Post Register and Mayor Rebecca Casper for sponsoring the Intermountain Energy Summit, to Julie Ann Goodrich and the Blackfoot Chamber of Commerce, to Shelly and Doug Sayer at Premier Technology, and to the Bingham County Commissioners.   I appreciate the time you took to meet with me, to show me the important work you are performing, and for your thoughtful questions.
The important national defense work being done by our military must be supported. I was happy to be part of this groundbreaking for the Naval Nuclear Propulsion Program.

Kathy and I send our thoughts and prayers to the victims in Charlottesville. White supremacy and their hateful rhetoric and violence, have no place in this country. Let today unite our nation against this evil rather than allow it to be divided by a petulant minority that does not represent the values of America. We thank the First Responders for their commitment to helping those in need and let us use their compassion and selflessness as strength to guide us though yesterday's ugly events.

"Building a Redfish to Stanley Trail was an important piece in the Boulder-White Clouds compromise. I'm pleased that individuals and families with children of all ages will be able to safely hike and bike from Redfish Lake to Stanley where they will be able to enjoy the stores, restaurants and bakery. This is a great development for recreation on our federal lands, tourism and the local economy."

"If the sun and moon should doubt, they'd immediately go out.”  William Blake | Poet Auguries of Innocence | 1863  #lookup #eclipse2017
NA

Idaho Congressman Mike Simpson issued this statement on the news that former Governor and Secretary of the Interior Cecil Andrus passed away on Thursday.   “Idaho and our nation have lost a truly great statesman and conservationist today.  Kathy and I send our prayers and thoughts to his family for their loss.    Governor Andrus will rightly be remembered as a legend in the conservation field.  It was fitting that he cut his political teeth protecting Castle Peak as I think they both have a lot in common.  They are giants in Idaho and icons to those who believe conservation is a necessity and not a luxury.    We will truly miss Cece, but we will always be reminded of how great he was as we are surrounded by his legacy of conservation.”
Speaking to the Jerome Chamber of Commerce today on the federal appropriations process.

My thoughts and prayers are with the people of Texas today. Amid the historic flooding taking place from #HurricaneHarvey, I'm thankful for all of the professional and citizen first responders from across the country who have mobilized in support.
I'm pleased to see the Department of Veterans Affairs has opened a new, state-of-the-art healthcare facility in Pocatello. The new facility will allow hundreds of additional veterans to receive care.

Proud to call Idaho Falls my home town! Thank you to Melaleuca, Rounds Trucking, and everyone in east Idaho donating food and supplies to #HurricaneHarvey relief efforts. Idaho's giving spirit is truly remarkable.

With 81 wildfires burning nearly 1.5 million acres across the West, it’s time to pass my Wildfire Disaster Funding Act (H.R. 2862). By changing the way wildfire suppression is funded, we can improve forest health and reduce future fuel loads.   In the meantime, the @lungassociation has some good tips on protecting yourself from the heavy smoke settling across our state.
Thank you for your service and commitment to our country, General Lafrenz. You'll be missed.
Looking forward to working with Tony Tooke, the new chief of the U.S. Forest Service. Tony was sworn-in today in Washington D.C. by Secretary of Agriculture Sonny Perdue.
NA
Never Forget. 9-11-01. #Red #White #Blue.

The Fiscal Year 2018 Appropriations Bills that passed the House today provide vital funding for Idaho interests, and include important policy provisions that make government more responsive to the people it serves.
Happy 70th Birthday to the United States Air Force. Thank you to all the men and women serving our country at home and abroad. #AirForce #MHAFB
Calling all veterans and stakeholders in the Salmon area: Boise VA Medical Center and the Boise VA Regional Office are hosting a Veterans Claims Clinic TOMORROW at the Salmon VA Outreach Clinic.

"Like the rest of the country, I'm stunned and horrified by the mass shooting that occurred last night in Las Vegas. Like Americans everywhere, I'm anxious to learn more about how and why this situation occurred. Though no words can heal our hurt, and no explanation will ever feel sufficient, I pray that all involved may find comfort as we process this devastating tragedy."
It’s #nuclearscienceweek and the city of Idaho Falls and the Idaho National Laboratory have been designated as this year’s host locations. Check out all the events taking place this week.
Congratulations to the South Central Community Action Center for their contributions to the Magic Valley for the last 50 years.

Congressman Simpson had the honor of breaking ground on Dwight D. Eisenhower National Memorial this morning. Congressman Simpson is a commissioner on the Dwight D. Eisenhower Memorial Commission and has played an influential role in working with the Eisenhower family, Commission, and Congress to ensure the 34th President of the United States is properly honored. (Pictured left to right with Congressman Simpson - Susan, Anne and David Eisenhower) #ILikeIke

Today is Veterans Day, a day to honor and thank our nation’s veterans and their families.  These heroes have dedicated themselves to protecting our American way of life, and it is because they serve that we may live freely and without fear.  On behalf of Idaho’s Second Congressional District, I thank our nation’s veterans for their selfless commitment to duty and the sacrifices they have made to keep us safe.  God bless you, and may God bless the United States of America.

Thanks to everyone who joined the Idaho STEP Challenge! It was a great journey with nearly 400 Idahoans participating. Whether you walked the 2,963 miles or came up a bit short – it was a great way to stay fit and engage our community in healthy activity. Keep walking, Idaho!
Simpson discusses the need to fix fire borrowing with Forest Service Chief Tony Tooke
Thank you to the 660th Ordnance Company in Pocatello. Pictures are from the A3 Farewell ceremony this weekend. God bless these soldiers- Idaho is eternally grateful for the tremendous sacrifice.

I am very pleased that the Department of Energy has opted to extend Battelle Energy Alliance’s contract to manage Idaho National Laboratory. This announcement is a recognition of the consistent and excellent performance by BEA and it will bring consistency and economic stability to our region. The world renowned researchers at the INL work every day to promote and ensure our nation’s energy security, and I could not be more proud of the cutting edge work they do.
Thank you to all the brave men and women who serve in the Idaho National Guard.

Exciting to see job creators furthering their investment in the United States and their hardworking employees, following the passage of tax reform. I look forward to more investments that will benefit American workers.
Tax reform producing good news for Idahoans.
